## Installation

You can install the released version of power from [CRAN](https://CRAN.R-project.org) with:

``` r
remotes::install_github("stufield/power")
```

## Loading `power`


```{r example}
library(power)
```


## Plot power curves

```{r curves, fig.height = 6, fig.width = 11}
plotPowerCurves(effect = seq(0.5, 2, 0.1), power.vec = seq(0.5, 0.9, 0.1))
```

## Plot power simulations

```{r sim-n, fig.height = 6, fig.width = 11}
# constant effect size
# must pass `nboot=`
set.seed(1)
size <- simulatePowerData(seq(10, 50, 2), delta = 1.2, nboot = 25)
size

# plot
plot(size)
```

```{r sim-d, fig.height = 6, fig.width = 11}
# constant sample size
set.seed(2)
delta <- simulatePowerData(seq(0.5, 2.5, 0.1), n = 20, nboot = 25)
delta

# plot
plot(delta)
```
